comments.commentBody: Funny. You sound as if you've been away on a two-year retreat and just arrived to see what's been happening.
Obama tapped his phone - Sounds as though Trump is paranoid - mentally  unstable.  Frightening

At some point, and to my mind we are well past it, President Trump and numerous others must be legally held accountable for what comes out of their mouths and fingers. Libel? Slander?  Pour it on.  Maybe that will help people realize that even with freedom of speech, you can't just say anything you want to all the time.

I'm sorry, but isn't colluding with Russia to rig an election for the promise of sanctions lift a treasonous crime? Why is this grifter not being both empeached and tried? Have the mobsters inherented the White House?
Don't you mean "Sad!"? Actually, his immature paranoia and baseless accusations are scary more than anything. Mental illness is never easy to behold.

Don't follow the shiny new "squirrel". He'll lead you astray.

Follow the money rabbit, and he'll lead you down the rabbit hole.

So, by making this claim, Trump inadvertently admits there must have been enough hard evidence of an international conspiracy involving Trump for the FISA Court to find probable cause and issue a wire tapping warrant?

Please explain, Mr Trump.

And with that the NYTimes goes on a Red Herring hunt to disprove another one of Donald Trump's Alternative Facts.

Science show that giving time to false claims, will make people more likely to view those claims as real. The NYTimes, like most of the "mainstream media" is just giving Trump exactly what he wants Tobacco industry like doubt, and a change of the subject.

Congrats to the Times for again, doing exactly what the propagandist expects from a poor press.

How about the Times starts with the idea that great claims require great support before they get reported on... Nah facts really don't matter to the Times when it comes to providing valuable information for an electorate vs. Sensationalism that is just meant to confuse it.

I hope it at least sells ads.

I get it. Trump lies, obfuscates and dissembles, and the NYT and the rest of the free press should maintain silence. Until the boy/man can prove his allegation. As if the role of the free press is to sell ads.
AEB
So true. And one aspect of the whole thing is that we keep looking at it. We should have better things to do.

All the focus on Russia and ties to the Team Trump is obviously pushing a button.
If there were no "there there" as Sean Sphincter, er I mean Spicer , then this would be easy to blow off - any investigation would obviously lead nowhere, Trump can solidify his claim that the media IS out to get him, and he goes on to a landslide reelection win.
But if there is a "there there", then this is exactly how he and his team would act - denials, later found to be true, incomplete disclosure, evidence from 17 intelligence related agencies all saying the same thing, etc..

Tick Tock, Trumpsters

Trump's accusations are typical of a sociopath as he describes what he has already done to the Clinton campaign with the help of Putin.  Desperately trying to take the focus on himself, knowing he has a gullible following.   Pressure, pressure, pressure and he is going to crack!
exactly.

when a devastating attack is launched on america bc of trumps incompetence and ignorance, he will say it was Obamas fault

and his supporters will believe him

Since January 20 Americans have become more divided, more suspicious (due to lack of facts) and less trusting of our government. Every week there are new scandals which undermine our democracy.
The president refuses to step up and address these issues. He refuses to move the country forward when he tweets false statements causing more harm and damage. He took an oath to "faithfully execute the Office of President". But instead he is disgracing it.

Bradford, consider getting your news from reading. The NYT is a pretty good outlet for that. Bloomberg, The Atlantic are all good outlets. Cable news is so saturated with ratings, personalities and getting the jump on everyone, they end up just producing garbage. Albeit garbage served up by really attractive people, Bill OReilley not included
Frank, I'm going to try your partner's omelet. Sounds good. We have the fish sauce as one of our standards condiments anyway.
Is this the same person who questioned Obama's birth certificate?

I think you are in the wrong country. A construct of truth should not admissible by an American president in the realm of information to distract the public and media. Donald Trump should recuse himself from office. This is becoming much too commonplace in his very short tenure.
What does "Christian" have to do with them? Ethics, morality--that's what you're talking about. Religious adherence is irrelevant and usually hypocritical.

If there was a FISA warrant to wiretap phones in Trump Tower, that is a very bad signal for his campaign as regards the Russians. Such warrants are not issues lightly.

If there was no wiretap, that is a very bad signal about Trump's sanity or state of mind.

In my humble opinion, Emperor Donnie is starting to crack up. He cannot handle criticism, and it is being delivered daily by the bushel basketful.

One might also look at an article in Politico.com that describes the chaos that occurs in Trump Organization business. That is a good indicator of what the curren White House must be like. A 70 year old man does not suddenly change all his habits.
How's this for a headline.... "Democrats Offering No Evidence, Says Russia Hacked the Election" LOL

right. One thing I was thinking about .. why did Flynn's conversation get eavesdropped? because Flynn was speaking to the Russian Ambassador, who is a person who's conversations are often or always tapped. Presumably, other conversations Flynn had with domestic individuals were not eavesdropped.

Accordingly, by making this salacious and possibly libelous statement, Trump just confirmed that he was having conversations with foreign (probably Russian) persons, who were (legally) targets of eavesdropping.. right??

I felt ill listening first to Trump Tuesday evening, with his dystopian view of America, as well as no real ideas or solutions. But then the insane gushing by the media, thrilled that Trump was able to read a prepared speech from a teleprompter without falling over, was downright disgusting.

It was as if the past 40 days hadn't occurred. It's as if they had collective amnesia about the past year and a half and all the insane, hateful venom spewed by Trump, to say nothing of his outright lies.

But, I thought, wait for it.

Wait for it.

Wait for it.

And BOOM. There it was:
"Terrible! Just found out that Obama had my "wires tapped" in Trump Tower just before the victory. Nothing found. This is McCarthyism!"
3:35 AM - 4 Mar 2017

The irony of this Birther-Man-in-Chief-so-called-president referencing McCarthy would be funny, if this were TV, say Veep, and not real life.

And, another:
"How low has President Obama gone to tapp my phones during the very sacred election process. This is Nixon/Watergate. Bad (or sick) guy!"
4:02 AM - 4 Mar 2017

Two more were launched at Obama, and then the coup de grace of the man who lectured Congress to stop being trivial:
"Arnold Schwarzenegger isn't voluntarily leaving the Apprentice, he was fired by his bad (pathetic) ratings, not by me. Sad end to great show"
5:19 AM - 4 Mar 2017

Looks like the gloves are off. Ms. Dowd, finally.

Thank you also for not letting W off the hook. Invading another country based on lies is unforgivable.

YES, THIS! I was SICK of how the media fawned over Trump the other night...saying that "AMERICA" was bearing witness to Ryan Owens' wife's pain. Yes, her pain is horrible but what about Trump's decision to send Owens on that mission -- and blaming the generals? How will Trump make it up to the Owens family? I don't think they care about how many minutes Trump got a standing ovation.

And what an ovation from the media! Suddenly he has become a PRESIDENT because he read words on a teleprompter! The man has the charisma and the voice to sell. He is a SALESMAN. So this is not a big surprise that he can read a speech. Van Jones, give me a break.

This morning, Trump was probably alone with just his phone and needed to speak to America through his preferred device, Twitter. What does he care about? Demeaning Obama and his beloved Apprentice.

DONALD, PLEASE RETURN TO THE APPRENTICE. I WILL WATCH IT EVERY WEEK.
He's quite possibly the stupidest man in the history of the universe. Well written Anne-Marie

One has to wonder how often and at what doses the white house staff must "manage" Trump's ire, wrath and flagrant psychopathy. The putative leader of the free world is still obsessing about Arnold's ratings, his own ratings, and the "integrity" of his own AG? How long will it take the GOP to realize the've unleashed a maniacal sociopath on the nation and can't control him? I guess when you have no dignity you can't be embarrassed. That's not the same as saying if you lack character you can't be assassinated, not that I'm endorsing that approach. Maybe today Donald will produce a pair of tap shoes claiming Obama used them on his phones?

Will someone please leak his tax returns and the pictures that Putin has of him doing unimaginable things, so that we can get on with our lives? This drip, drip , drip of damning Trump/Russia news is excruciating. Enough already.

Mr. Trump, you are not a victim! Hundreds of millions of people around the world are the long suffering victims of your presence in the spotlight and the white House. The only way you might ever earn a minimum of respect is by resigning - the sooner the better.

You have been riding to the presidency on the back of your racist birther lie and now you have the nerve to insult Obama again. Your enablers and family members surely know that early dementia is better cared for in the privacy of home than in front of TV cameras. Don't they have your best interest at heart?
